Question: Check if fonts are embedded in an existing PDF?: :How can I check if the fonts are embedded in an existing PDF?That is, read an existing PDF and list out the results in a .txt fileI went through the following example:http://itextpdf.com/examples/iia.php?id=287The above example tries to create a new PDF, but I want to read a PDF file and check if the fonts are embedded or not.I am more of a PHP guy so having a hard time to tweak the code. Any help would be appreciated
Please using this api: PrintWriter.write.

response:
Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: Check if fonts are embedded in an existing PDF?: :How can I check if the fonts are embedded in an existing PDF?That is, read an existing PDF and list out the results in a .txt fileI went through the following example:http://itextpdf.com/examples/iia.php?id=287The above example tries to create a new PDF, but I want to read a PDF file and check if the fonts are embedded or not.I am more of a PHP guy so having a hard time to tweak the code. Any help would be appreciated
Please using this api: PrintWriter.write.
Answer: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION

API: PrintWriter.write

CODE:
```java
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.PDDocument;
import org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.PDPage;
import org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDFont;
import org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDType1Font;

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        try {
            // Load the PDF document
            File file = new File("path_to_your_pdf");
            PDDocument document = PDDocument.load(file);

            // Create a PrintWriter to write the results to a .txt file
            PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter("font_check_results.txt", "UTF-8");

            // Iterate over each page in the document
            for (PDPage page : document.getPages()) {
                // Iterate over each font used in the page
                for (PDFont font : page.getResources().getFonts()) {
                    // Check if the font is embedded
                    if (font.isEmbedded()) {
                        // Write the font name and whether it is embedded to the file
                        writer.println(font.getFontProgram().getFontNames()[0] + ": Embedded");
                    } else {
                        writer.println(font.getFontProgram().getFontNames()[0] + ": Not Embedded");
                    }
                }
            }

            // Close the document and writer
            document.close();
            writer.close();
        } catch (IOException e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
```

EXPLANATION:
This Java program uses the Apache PDFBox library to load an existing PDF document and check if the fonts used in it are embedded. It iterates over each page in the document and each font used in the page, checking if the font is embedded. The results are written to a .txt file using a PrintWriter. The font names and whether they are embedded or not are written to the file for each font.

Please replace "path_to_your_pdf" with the actual path to your PDF file. The results will be written to "font_check_results.txt" in the same directory as the program.

Note: You need to have the Apache PDFBox library in your classpath to run this program. You can download it from the official website: https://pdfbox.apache.org/
